Amale is a friendly and kind young woman. She’s from Lebanon and is 29 years old. She got married a short period ago and has two children. She lives with her husband and children. Amale and her husband are working really hard to provide the family with the needed income.  And since she noticed that their income does not satisfy their needs, she decided to launch her clothing business from her home with the small amount of money she already had. She sells a wide variety of clothes from which she earns a fair amount of money daily. Her husband also works at a local company as he is their main income provider. 

To better develop her work, she’s requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her business, such as pants, t-shirts and many other items

loans.name: Ayawa Marcelline

texts.fr: Marcelline est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et divers dans sa boutique dont elle est la seule gérante. Mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 05 scolarisés, elle a 49 ans et désire agrandir son commerce et plus tard devenir une grossiste. Pour se faire, elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de notre institution pour acheter les produits de son commerce. Ses économies quant à elle seront destinées à garnir d’avantage sa boutique et assurer l'épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Marcelline is a retailer of grocery items and general merchandise in her store, where she is the only one running it. Married and the mother of six children, of who five are in school, she is 49 years old and wishes to expand her business and later to become a wholesale merchant. To do so, Marcelline is requesting a third loan from our institution to purchase goods for her business. Her savings will go toward more furnishings and supplies for her store and toward ensuring that her family thrives.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Fatima Ama

texts.en: Fatima Ama cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) for sale and she serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Ebubonko near  Abura. She is married and has 2 children. Fatima has done this for 5 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in feeding the family and paying their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale

loans.name: Harriet Ekua

texts.en:
Harriet Ekua is a dressmaker.  She make dresses for sale at Ebuboku, near Abura. 

She has been a seamstress for five years now.  Harriet  is married, with three children. She uses her income to support  her husband in paying their accommodation and utility bills. 

Harriet will use her loan to purchase fabrics to make dresses for sale. With her new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics to make dresses for sale.

loans.name: Tamari

texts.en:
Tamari is 25 years old and lives in Gurjaani district with her family -- husband and mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family earns its living through an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where nuts are grown. Tamari and her husband do all the proper seasonal work to get a good harvest. Tamari is a very hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.

She requested a loan to purchase calves and piglets. She will raise the animals and sell them at a good price. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Tamari will purchase building materials and renovate her house, which is old and damaged. Tamari awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves and piglets

loans.name: Hans

texts.en:
Hans lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a green grocer which he has been operating for five years.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuation and inflation and customers not paying on time. 

Hans is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase timber for carpentry. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His dream is to see his business grow to wholesale and start a carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy timber for carpentry.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old.  He is married to Yukabeth, and together they have four children.

Peter is a dairy farmer, and he has been in the business for the past 12 years.  He will use the loan amount to purchase another dairy cow.

This is his second business loan from KADET LTD.  He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He hopes to purchase a plot and build a house for his family

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline is 25 years old. She owns a grinding machine which she uses as a source of business. She has been running this machine for seven years. With the loan, she wants to buy another machine to generate more earnings. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: To buy another grinding machine for use as a source of generating income.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert lives in Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. 

Robert owns a transport business which he has been operating for three years.  He is applying for a loan of KES 41,900 to buy a new motorcycle.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group.  He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. 
 
His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings. Robert's dream is to expand and buy another motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is single and she lives at Ebubonko near Abura. She is a hairdresser and she owns the beauty salon. She has been a hairdresser for 8 years. She uses her income to pay for her accommodations and utility bills.  

Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire  equipment to make work easy.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 24 years old. He sells clothes and has been in the business for three years. With this loan, he wants to add more clothes, such as sweaters and trousers, to his inventory. The profits from the business will be used for building a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a hairdresser. She owns the beauty salon at Ebubonko near Abura. Aba is single and has one child. She has been a hairdresser for 15 years. She uses her income to feed, clothe and pay her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions and hair dryer for her beauty salon. She hopes to use the new profits to acquire equipment to make work easy.

loans.use: to buy hair creams, hair extensions and a hairdryer for her beauty salon

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 34-year-old Lebanese single man living on his own. He is obligated to cover his household expenses as he is the only one responsible for having a proper way of living.  He started to work as a painter many years ago and still does. He also makes Gypsum decorations. He works on a free-lance basis and is considered friendly, especially by his loyal customers. 
Today, he is requesting to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional painting supplies and Gypsum boards to be able to handle his new project. This loan will open a new door for him to take on bigger projects and increase his productivity by 30%. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects and increase his revenues.

loans.use: to purchase more painting supplies and Gypsum boards to be able to handle his new project

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. 

He owns a cosmetic shop that he has been operating for a two years. Besides this, he also runs a clearing and forwarding firm.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group.   He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are purchasing stock, debts, and high fuel and transport costs.

John is applying for a loan of KES 41,900 to purchase additional stocks of cosmetics.  His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings. His dream is to expand and be a wholesaler of cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio Juan pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO,el socio continua brindando el servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja años en este rubro el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,el socio trabaja todos los dias durante el dia desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia,a la vez el socio cuenta con un pequeño negocio de tienda de abarrotes el cual espera que le valla bien ya que recien tiene poco tiempo su negocio,el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir trabajando para el bienestar de sus hijos.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su auto.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juan is a member of Vallecito Communal Bank, and he keeps on providing a taxi service. He has been engaged in this activity for many years, and things are going very well thanks to the dedication he daily works with. He works every day, approximately form 6 am to 9 pm; he is a responsible and diligent person and through this activity he provides for his family. At the same time Juan also runs a small grocery store and he hopes this activity will go well since he hasn’t had much time lately for this second activity. He wishes to keep on working for the wellbeing of his children.
Juan is requesting a loan to buy tires for his car.
Juan is grateful for the loan he has received and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr Julio Carlos tiene 37 años es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres.
El Sr. Julio Carlos se  dedica a la compra y  venta de caballos que luego son faenados para la elaboración de embutidos. El señor se encarga de comprar los caballos de diferentes puntos de país y venderlos en los mataderos de la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Solicita el préstamo para compra mayor cantidad de caballos debido a que tuvo una oferta que desea aprovechar.
texts.en:
Julio Carlos, 37, is single and lives in his parents' house.
He works buying and selling horses that are then slaughtered to make sausages. He is in charge of buying the horses from different parts of the country and selling them to the slaughterhouses in the city of Carapeguá. He is applying for the loan to buy a greater quantity of horses because he had an offer that he wants to take advantage of.

loans.use: to buy horses in order to later sell them to the slaughterhouses

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is a Mexican artisan who specializes in handcrafted jewelry. She would like to invest in the purchase of such materials as silver and natural gemstones for production.

Mariana has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I spent most of my childhood in a small village within a beautiful valley not far from Mexico City, where I was born. Being surrounded by nature, I had the opportunity to grow up in great freedom and in contact with all things natural. After high school, I kept having dreams of becoming a jeweler and I could even see the designs I had created. I decided to follow my dream and have loved it from the very first moment I began working with metal, gems, and fire. I enjoy traveling and meeting people of different cultures. That's how I can feel inspiration growing within me. I enjoy playing with symmetry, as well as combining geometric figures with organic shapes, contrasting textures, colors and, in some cases, metals." 

"I'm encouraged by this micro-credit loan because I know it comes from people who are committed to support the development of artisans and are respectful of our work. This micro-credit is a testimony of your values; thank you!"

Use the link below to view Mariana's jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=7852

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of such materials as silver and natural gemstones for production.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells fabric and has spent four years in the business of selling fabrics. With the loan, she plans to buy more fabrics to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a clothing business which he has been operating for four years. He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is seasonal weather.

Jackson is applying for a loan of 52,250 Kenya shillings to purchase an additional stock of clothes. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to finish his projects that are pending. His dream is to see his business grow and start a boutique and employ people in his boutique.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is age 29. She sells fabrics. She has spent eleven years in the business. With the loan, she wants to buy more fabrics for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. 

He owns a cloth business that he has been operating for a four years.  Albert is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of clothes. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group.  He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation; customers not paying on time, and purchasing stocks.

His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business into a larger boutique. His dream is to see his business grow and start a mobile money business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of clothes.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité "El Progreso" cuenta con  12 integrantes que  son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.
La sra Maria Elisa  es Presidenta del grupo, ella tiene un pequeño almacen en frente a su domicilio donde día a día expone sus productos a la venta. ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, higiene personal también de alimentos no perecederos como fideos, arroz, yerba, etc.
Su deseo es progresar junto con la Fundación Paraguaya y que el grupo se vaya fortaleciendo cada día más, manifiesta que se siente muy a gusto en su comité y que también  alentaría a sus compañeras del grupo a seguir trabajando para el logro de sus objetivos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Progreso" [Progress] comprises 12 members who are neighbors and know each other well. Maria Elisa is president of the group and has a small store in the front of her house where she displays her merchandise every day. She sells cleaning and personal hygiene products and non-perishable foods such as noodles, tea, rice, and more.

She wants to move forward working with Fundación Paraguaya, and her group is growing stronger by the day. She says she is happy with her committee position and also would encourage her fellow members to keep striving to meet their objectives.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cleaning and personal hygiene products, tea, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO,la socia tiene 29 años,04 hijos y es conviviente,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesania,la socia elabora textiles como chompas de alpaca de diferentes tamaños y modelos,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negoco,la socia elabora las chompa para luego distribuirlas a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como tiendas del sector turismo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de lana de alpaca para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Ruth, 29, is a member of the communal bank VALLECITO and lives with her partner and 4 children. Her daily activities are dedicated to selling handicrafts and making textiles like alpaca sweaters in a range of sizes and styles. Ruth has had this business for years, and she feels it has prospered with the daily effort she puts into it. She makes the sweaters and distributes them to the customers who request them most often, such as stores catering to tourists. 

Ruth is responsible and committed, qualities which have made it possible for her to provide for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy alpaca wool for her business. She is grateful for the credit offered and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy alpaca wool for her business.

loans.name: Divine

texts.en:
Divine is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved sculptures and masks. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, paints and sandpaper to continue production.

Divine has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My trade name 'Top Cambodia' comes from my desire to succeed in life. That’s where 'Top' comes from. And 'Cambodia' is in honor of my paternal grandfather, who served there on a peacemaking mission, and who died the same day I was born. I come from a family of carvers, and it was my maternal grandfather who taught me how to carve. I would always stop by his workshop on the way back from school. I've managed to bring a few of my relatives in my village to join me in Accra. I make the designs, they carve them, and I finish them. My experience as a carver helps me judge when a piece has been properly carved, so I also do quality control."

"I thank everyone involved in this microcredit for thinking about me and for giving me this opportunity. It will enable me to buy more materials for the creation of new designs."

Use the link below to view Divine's masks and carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=8128

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials such as wood, paints and sandpaper to continue production.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Gabriela;La socia continua trabajando en una empresa privada ,la socia trabaja desde las 08:00am hasta las 06:00pm ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir brindandoles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

La socia solicita el credito para los estudios de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is Gabriela. She continues working for a private company.  The member works from 8 am until 6 pm, and has worked in this business for a long time.  It's going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day.  She is a responsible and hard-working person, this being the way that she gets her family ahead.  She wishes to be able to keep working to be able to continue offering a better quality of life to her children.

The member requests the loan to pay for her childrens' studies.

She is happy about the loan and pledges to complete the payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her childrens' studies.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 35 years old. She has six children aged between one and thirteen. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she plans to buy more clothes and the profits from the business will be used mainly for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.en: Adzo, a palm oil extractor and plantain-seller in Abura, is divorced and has four children. Adzo, who received a junior high education will use this loan to buy more fruits to make oil and plantain for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a house.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to make oil and plantain for resale.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is 47 years old. She is married and has four children. She owns a bar. With the loan, she will buy more beer and soda for resale. She plans to use the profits for building a house in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama has been selling maize, cassava and plantain in Frami near Abura for 12 years. A divorced mother of four, Ama uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of maize, cassava and plantain to resell. With the new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, cassava and plantain to resell.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La socia Edelmira tiene 35 años edad,es casada y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende arroa,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 10 añops en este negocio de tienda de abarrotes,el sueño de la socia es mapliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Edelmira, 35, is married and has three children. She works at her business, a grocery store. She sells rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has had this grocery store for 10 years and her dream is to be able to expand it. She is applying for the loan to buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 30 years old. He sells different items in the boutique. He has been running the boutique for the past ten years. He wants the loan to add more items such as yeast, sugar, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale such as yeast, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lati

texts.en:
Lati is a 38-year-old woman living with her mother and her son, age 16. Four years ago her husband passed away in an accident. Since then she has been managing her family. She was doing labor work after her husband died. Then she started an incense stick business. She purchases the incense sticks, incense stick cover boxes and incense stick cover polythene from the wholesaler and packages all the incense sticks in the cover boxes and sells these in the market. She earns 3,000 to 3,500 Indian rupees (INR) per month from this business. 

To get the raw materials, Lati goes 50 to 100 kilometers far from her house. As a woman, it is very difficult to go very frequently, and it increases the expenses of her business. She wants to purchase the raw materials in bulk so that she can reduce her costs and she will not need to go to the market very frequently for the raw materials.

Lati has requested a loan of 25,000 INR to purchase the raw materials (incense sticks, cover boxes and cover polythene) for her business. She has a dream of making admission for a good college and providing better education so that her son can work in a multinational company.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing incense sticks, incense sticks cover boxes, and incense stick cover polythene for her incense stick business.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina tiene 36 años, está casada con Nazario, con quien tiene tres hijos, pero ahora sólo vive con dos de ellos: Julisa y Etson, a quienes cuida en la casa que le heredaron sus padres hace 19 años.  
La zona donde vive Aquilina es ganadera, por esa razón comenzó con la compra y venta de ganado vacuno. Compra vacas de buena calidad, las cuales cuida hasta que crezcan, preocupándose que den buena leche, pues es un requisito para que pueda obtener altas ganancias, cuando se encuentran listas, junto a su esposo las negocian con algún ganadero. Paralelo a ello, siembra papa, maíz  y habas en sus terrenos propios.  

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se siente tranquila por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que depositan en ella, prometiendo cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado por personas solidarias y responsables.
Aquilina invertirá este dinero en la compra de una vaca de calidad para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Aquilina, 36, is married to Nazario, with whom she has three children; only two live with them: Julisa and Etson. They care for their children in the house they inherited from her parents 19 years ago. The area where Aquilina lives specializes in cattle raising. Therefore, she began her business buying and selling cattle. She buys and raises good quality cattle, hoping they will yield good milk so that she can make high profits when they are ready for market. She works with her husband and another rancher. She also grows potatoes, corn, and beans on her own land. 

This is Aquilina's sixth loan cycle with MFP, and she feels comfortable with the support she receives and grateful for the institution's confidence in her. She promises to make her payments on time so that she doesn't disappoint her group members, who are caring and responsible. Aquilina will use the loan to buy a quality cow to add to her stock.

loans.use: to buy a quality cow to add to her stock.

loans.name: Hemedi

texts.en:
Hemedi lives in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a transport business, a business he has been operating for twelve years. He started the business through his own savings. Hemedi carries tourists who visit the area on guided tours along the coastal line.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenges he is facing are high transport and fuel costs, finding customers and seasonal weather.

Hemedi is applying for a loan of 99,100 Kenyan shillings (KES) to carry out major repairs on his van. His extra income from the loan will be used to increase his savings. His future plan is to become a major dominant in transportation in the area.

loans.use: to carry out major repairs on his van.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells  jewelry and accessories at Ebubonko near Abura. Elizabeth is married to a driver and has one child. She has been in this business for five years now. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills.  Her loan will be used to purchase jewelry and  accessories to sell. She hopes to use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and accessories to sell

loans.name: Kofi Tall

texts.en:
Ghana's Kofi Tall is a master carver specializing in the traditional oware game sets. He would like to invest in the purchase of sanding sealer, lacquer and paints to continue production. Kofi has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Nicknamed "Tall" for his impressive height, Kofi is a master craftsman of the world famous oware (mancala) game.  "After trying my hand at different jobs, one day I walked into a friend's art studio at the National Cultural Center and asked him to show me anything I could do around there, and I would do it. I did not realize that it was the beginning of a career. Then we received an order for carved oware games and within four weeks I had developed and mastered my own style. Now I also enjoy researching the game and its history. I wrote 'The Rules for Playing Oware' booklet, a practical manual officially recognized by the Oware Society in London and Ghana."

"Assistance such as this microcredit will encourage me to produce new items and improve my cash flow. I thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Kofi's oware sets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1416

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for the crafting of his oware game sets.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six children. He owns a timber hardware business, which he has been operating for 10 years.

Francis learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuation and inflation, purchasing stock, and high fuel and transport costs. 

Francis is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a multipurpose machine. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy more timber. His dream is to see his business grow into a bigger hardware business and open more hardware businesses.

loans.use: to buy a multipurpose machine.

loans.name: Dennickson

texts.en:
Dennickson lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a timber hardware business, which he has been operating for 6 years.

Dennickson learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are price fluctuation, inflation, and high fuel and transport costs. 

Dennickson is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of timber. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to buy more timber. His dream is to see his business grow bigger and open another one shop.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of timber.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a hairdresser at Ebubonko near Abura.  Araba is married and has two children.  Araba has been a hairdresser for 4 years.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding and clothing their children.  Her loan will be used to purchase hair creams, hair extensions, and a hair dryer for her beauty salon.   She hopes to use the new profits to build a better beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase hair creams,  hair extensions, and a hair dryer  for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo, aged 43, is a simple farmer. He operates a farming business as his source of income. He is married to Josie and blessed with four children. He finds it difficult to provide for their needs but despite his situation, he is giving his best in preparing for their future. He is looking for a better living by acquiring more income.

To attain his aspirations, Alfredo is requesting an additional loan amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers for his farming business. He hopes that through his hard work he will attain more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Feride

texts.en:
Feride is married and has five children; the oldest is 20 and the youngest is 9 years old. All of them attend school. They live in central Albania in a very rural village.

Feride has been selling dairy to locals for the past 15 years and the profit has been fine, according to her. She has been able to build a good and steady clientele over the years in this business.

She now plans to expand the business by adding some more cows to the existing herd. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan this time. It will be a great help to her. Note that this will be Feride's first loan. 

Feride is thankful to Kiva and VisionFund Albania for the financial support.

loans.use: to add more cows to the existing herd.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru:
Тамара уже 15 лет занимается предпринимательской деятельностью в своем родном городе Мелитополе. Она торгует женской одеждой на одном из местных рынков, имеет хороший опыт работы в этой сфере. 
Тамара планирует вложить кредит КИВА суммой в 4 000 гривен в закупку 10 свитеров по 200 гривен и 14 блузок по 140 гривен для последующей реализации в своем контейнере.
texts.en:
Tamara has been doing business in her hometown Melitopol for 15 years. She sells women's clothing at one of the local markets, and she has a great experience working in this area. 

Tamara plans to invest the loan from Kiva, in the amount of 4,000 hryvnia, in the purchase of 10 sweaters costing 200 hryvnia each, and 14 blouses costing 140 hryvnia each. The clothes will subsequently be sold at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sweaters and 14 blouses for selling at her stall

loans.name: Ryte

texts.en:
Ryte is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Ryte provides habal-habal or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Ryte has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Amalia

texts.es: Rosa Amalia de cincuenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su hijo, su hermano y sus sobrinos, ella posee una venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas, es muy conocida en la zona pues prepara las tortillas mas ricas del lugar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa, y luchadora siempre esta buscando alternativas que le den la oportunidad de forjarse un futuro mas prospero, quiere poner todo de su parte y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el triunfo, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, cal, gas propano, etc. Rosa Amalia tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Rosa Amalia is fifty-seven years old and lives with her son, brother, and nephews. She owns a tortilla shop. She has had the business for several years and has acquired considerable experience in sales. She is very well known in the region since she makes the most delicious tortillas in the area. She has made many clients for herself, since people prefer her business for the quality of the food, the good prices and the excellent service.

Rosa is dedicated to her work, active, and determined. She is always seeking alternatives that will give her the opportunity to forge a more prosperous future. She wants to do her best and she doesn't think of giving up before achieving success. In the past few months, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment. 

This is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will permit her to buy corn, lime, and propane gas, etc. Rosa Amalia has good credit references and assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time hopes that she will be able to bring some economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and propane gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David specializes in weaving wool rugs and tapestries.  To expand production, he would like to invest in a bulk purchase of cotton and alpaca wool.  David has been selling through NOVICA since 2000.  

This is his story:

David's grandparents and parents were weavers who inherited this art from their predecessors.  "I essentially learned through observation.  Nevertheless, I have taken several textile courses.  My work focuses on resuscitating our ancestral culture and linking it to the present.  I work with my family, and our materials include wool, cotton, and both natural and artificial dyes.  For the natural dyes, we cultivate the plants ourselves, including walnut, tare, molle and alder.  Everything we do, we do with love and a high regard for quality and professionalism.  We work very hard to weave the best possible finished product.  I would like to thank you very much for this microcredit.  I am certain that it will help our business immensely."

Use the link below to view David's rugs and tapestries on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1857

loans.use: to purchase cotton and alpaca wool in bulk for his weaving business.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia lives together with her husband, who is in electronics, and 3 children at Frami near Abura. She sells footwear, which she has done for 16 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Leticia will use her loan to purchase footwear to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase footwear for resale.

loans.name: Yulia

texts.ru:
Юлия живет и работает в Новой Каховке. Она торгует стильной женской одеждой. Арендует торговое место у администрации одного местного торгового центра. В торговле она уже 7 лет. 
В этот раз Юлии необходима сумма в 4000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить осеннюю одежду на продажу, а именно, кофты, свитера, юбки и брюки. Юлия уже имеет достаточный опыт торговли, знает, когда и где лучше брать товар. Вот и в этот раз она запланировала поездку на закупку осенней одежды и надеется недорого приобрести новую партию качественного и модного товара.
texts.en:
Yulia lives and works in Novaya Kahovka. She sells trendy women's clothing. Yulia rents a stall in a local shopping center. She has been in clothing sales for seven years.
This time Yulia needs 4,000 UAH to buy fall clothing for sale, such as tops, sweaters, skirts, and slacks. Yulia is an experienced merchant and knows when and where to buy merchandise. This time Yulia has planned a trip to buy fall clothing and hopes to buy a new batch of quality and fashionable merchandise at an affordable price.

loans.use: to purchase a new batch of quality and fashionable merchandise

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
El Sra. Mirna es soltera, tiene 1  hijo menor que aún está  cursando la escuela primaria. Gracias al trabajo que está realizando educa a su hijo, y compra todas las necesidades de su hogar. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos. 
Mirna tiene un negocio propio de buffet de comidas que había comprado con  mucho esfuerzo. Se inicio en esa actividad con la ayuda de sus padres que también realizan la misma actividad en otra Ciudad. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar los ingredientes como salsas, pastas, carnes,etc necesarios para que el negocio continúe.
texts.en: Mirna is single and has one small son that is attending primary school.  Thanks to job she is doing, she is able to educate her son and purchase all the household necessities.  She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments.  Mirna has her own buffet meal business that she was able to purchase by working hard. She started the business with her parents’ help as they also have the same type of business in another city.  She is requesting the loan to purchase sauce, pasta, meat, and other ingredients to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase sauce, pasta, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Antonieta has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothes like pants, blouses, and skirts. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more clothes to resell.

Antonieta is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Trifon

texts.en:
Trifon is 27 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. He provides habal-habal or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance.

Trifon became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Trifon hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina is 56 years old, single and living in the Philippines.  She buys and sells copra (dried coconut meat) in her community.  She has had this business for seven years, and is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more copra to resell.  Rufina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more copra (dried coconut) to resell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a seamstress; she makes dresses for sale at Frami near Abura. She has been a seamstress for 6 years now.  

Patience is married with 3 children. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  Patience will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is a petty trader; she trades in ladies wear, underwear, and braziers and panties, which she has done for 7 years. She lives at Frami near Abura.  Afia is a single parent and has 4 children.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children and to pay their school fees.  Afia will use her loan to purchase children wear, underwear, and ladies wear to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she wishes to build a shop to enable her sell dresses.

loans.use: to purchase children wear, underwear, and ladies wear to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old, married and has four children. She makes and sells doughnuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for two years. She has managed to improve her business through Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.

Christine hopes to open a hotel in the future. She has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy ingredients for her doughnuts such as wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.es:
Amilcar tiene 55 años, su esposa es Maribel, con quien tiene tres hijos. La casa donde viven la alquilan desde hace 4 años.  
En su barrio es una persona muy reconocida, pues hace 18 años inventó una forma muy fácil para trasportar la carga de los terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad. Las llaman “carretas ecológicas”, son atadas al lomo del burro para que jale la carreta, cargando muchos kilos de productos. “En todo este tiempo vendí un promedio de dos mil carretas en todo el valle, y en la actualidad vendo un promedio de tres a la semana”, afirma con mucha alegría. En temporada de siembra tiene más acogida, los demás meses dedica su tiempo a la fabricación de jaulas y pequeños puestos de madera para la venta ambulante, como también realiza el trabajo de pintado y soldadura, “por eso me llaman mil oficios”, comenta Amilcar. 

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y se siente tranquilo por el apoyo que recibe, además de agradecer la confianza que le dan, prometiendo cumplir con sus cuotas de manera puntual, pues no defraudará a su grupo, conformado por personas solidarias y responsables.
Amilcar invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de llantas y madera, al por mayor, para seguir construyendo sus carretas.
texts.en:
Amilcar is fifty-five years old. He has three children with his wife, Maribel. They have rented the house where they live for the past four years. He is very well-known in his neighborhood since eighteen years ago he invented a very simple means of transporting cargo from agricultural areas to the city. It is called an "ecological wagon," and it is tied to the back of a donkey, which pulls the wagon, carrying many kilos of products. 

"In all this time I sold approximately two thousand wagons throughout the valley, and I currently sell an average of three per week," Amilcar affirms happily. Demand is greatest during the planting season, and in the other months he spends his time making cages and little wood pieces for sale door-to-door, which is also how he markets his painting and welding work—"this is why they call me 'thousand-jobs,'" Amilcar comments. 

This is his sixth loan with MFP and he is relieved by the support he receives, as well as grateful for the confidence that it gives him. He promises to comply with his debts in a punctual manner in order not to disappoint his group, which is made up of supportive and responsible people.

Amilcar will use the money from this loan to buy tires and wood wholesale in order to continue making his wagons.

loans.use: to buy tires and wood wholesale in order to continue constructing his wagons.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
EL socio Gabriel pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL,el socio continua con su negocio de venta de artesania,el lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio elabora diferentes modelos de artesania,para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como el sector turismo,el socio es una persona resposanble siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante. 

EL socio solicito el credito para la compra de artesania para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a member of the communal bank, SAN RAFAEL, and has a business selling crafts.  He has been doing this for years and does well due to his daily commitment to his business.  He makes different crafts in order to later sell them to clients who most request it; the tourism sector.  This member is responsible a quality that has helped him get ahead.  Gabriel solicited the loan in order to purchase crafts for his business. 

The member is thankful for the loan and commits to his established payment timetable.

loans.use: to purchase crafts for his business

loans.name: Hawasafa

texts.en: Hawasafa  is a small trader. She sells ladies' footwear, bags, fabric and other items at Abura. She is single and has one child. As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her child and pay school fees. She will use her loan to buy ladies' footwear, bags and fabric to sell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy ladies' footwear, bags and fabric to sell

loans.name: Roderic

texts.en:
Roderic is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Roderic provides habal-habal or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for the maintenance.

Roderic became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Gatikrusna

texts.en:
Gatikrusna is a 27-year-old physically-challenged person living with his parents, two brothers and a sister-in-law. He owns and manages a variety shop where he sells biscuits, grains, onions, potatos, pickles, edible oil, etc. He earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month.

Gatikrusna wants to increase his inventory by purchasing more stock of what he sells and to introduce a new product line of soft drinks in his shop. He says that there is no other shop which sells soft drinks in his village so, by selling soft drinks, he will be able to increase his customer base.

Gatikrusna has requested a loan of 30,000 INR for purchasing more stock and a refrigerator to keep soft drinks in. He has a dream of replacing his house made up of mud with a concrete house.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing biscuits, grains, onions, potatos, pickles, edible oil, etc., and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Marie Josee

texts.en: Marie Josee is 30 years old. She is married with four children, all of which go to school. She sells fabrics and threads. She wants the loan to buy more fabrics for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – предприниматель из Мелитополя. Она торгует на одном из местных рынков, продает женскую одежду. Работая в сфере рыночной торговли уже 14 лет, она смогла приобрести собственное торговое место и свой круг клиентов. Наиболее ходовыми товарами среди ее ассортимента являются блузы, платья, пиджаки и куртки. 
Светлана в начале осенне-зимнего сезона необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 4 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить 10 штук платьев по 250 гривен, а также 5 пиджаков по 300 гривен под реализацию этой осенью.
texts.en:
Svetlana is an entrepreneur from Melitopol. She is a retailer at one of the local markets and sells women's clothing. Having worked as a marketplace merchant for the past 14 years, Svetlana has been able to set up her own retail outlet and acquire regular customers. Her most popular products are blouses, dresses, blazers and jackets.

At the start of the fall-winter season, Svetlana needs additional capital in the amount of 4,000 hryvnia to purchase 10 dresses at 250 hryvnia each, as well as 5 blazers at 300 hryvnia each, for sale in the fall.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dresses and 5 blazers for her clothing shop

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Kay is a hard-working father who is engaged in trading firewood and hard coal to generate income. This business comes after rice farming, and it earns him a good income for his household. Kay has been running these businesses for over 30 years from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. 

He is 47 years old, and he has a child attending local school. He and his wife have agreed to educate their child up to a high level 

Kay wants to maintain his income from his firewood trading business.  He is asking for an additional capital of 1,500,000 KHR to buy firewood to have in stock for a constant sale. He believes that the loan will help him to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to have in stock for a constant sale.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Luna has a store that sells fish like milk fish, sardines and flying fish. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy a variety of fish to resell.

Luna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn  is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with three children.

Marlyn has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marlyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marfe

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Marfe works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling chicharon in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from tricycle transportation. Marfe is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more chicharon to sell to customers.

Marfe has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more chicharon to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. She owns a retail shop, which she has been operating for ten years.

She learned about Milango through friends, who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation, theft, and purchasing stock. 

Mary is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy a weighing scale and cereals. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her savings. Her dream is to see her business grow and own a big store for cereals.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale and cereals.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 34 años, está casada con Hugo, tienen un hijo llamado Raúl, a quien cuidan con mucho amor, en la casa que compraron hace 12 años. 
Llegó la temporada de siembra y Vilma se retrazó un poco, pues le faltaba capital de trabajo para algunos gastos. Ahora se encuentra trabajando en la siembra, pues obtuvo el dinero faltante gracias a su grupo, quienes son personas solidarias. Su actividad económica se centra en la siembra de productos alimenticios como papa, habas, alverja y cebada, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues según cuenta, posee terrenos agrícolas propios en los que siembra, pero a veces no se abastece por lo que tiene que asociarse con otros agricultores, quienes ponen el terreno, mientras ella cuida y fertiliza los productos. “Obtengo la recompensa cuando vendo la cosecha a los compradores mayoristas, quienes distribuyen a diferentes ciudades del país”, comenta. Ahora desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos y aumentando su ganado, ya que tiene seis vacas que le producen leche, que comercializa, obteniendo un ingreso de dinero diario. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Central Checche” y este es su crédito número 9 con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero. Le gusta trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio, asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Vilma invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus sembríos de papa y habas.
texts.en:
Vilma, 34, is married to Hugo. They have a son named Raúl, whom they adore and care for in the home they bought 12 years ago. The planting season arrived, and Vilma fell behind a bit because she lacked working capital to pay her expenses. She is now planting because her group, all caring people, provided the money. She grows crops such as potatoes, beans, vetch, and barley, which she carefully tends. Vilma says she owns farmland among the plots she plants, but sometimes she doesn't use it because she partners with other farmers who plant, while she tends and fertilizes the crops. “I reap the rewards when the harvest is sold to wholesale buyers who distribute it to different cities in the country," she says. 

Now she would like to improve her plantings and expand her stock; she already has six cows producing milk that she sells daily for income. She is a member of the communal bank “Central Checche.”  This is her 9th credit cycle with MFP, and she hopes to continue receiving its support. She likes working with her group because she learns new things about her business every day. She promises to make her payments on time. Vilma will use the proceeds from this loan to buy organic fertilizers to spread over her potato and bean plantings.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to spread over her potato and bean plantings.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей с семьей живет в Новой Каховке. Он торгует компьютерной техникой, а также предоставляет услуги ее обслуживания и ремонта. Этим бизнесом Андрей занимается уже 14 лет. На данный момент он арендует торговую площадь у администрации торгового центра, где расположен его небольшой магазинчик/сервисный центр. Наиболее ходовыми товарами у него являются ноутбуки, мониторы, системные блоки, принтеры. 
Андрей заметил, что у него появилась необходимость пополнить комплектующие к персональным компьютерам, но имеющихся у него средств недостаточно для закупки всего, что он планировал приобрести. Поэтому Андрей обратился в КИВА за кредитом в размере 4 000 гривен. Андрей – женат, у него двое сыновей. Ему надо кормить семью, поэтому Андрей планирует и в дальнейшем заниматься бизнесом, вкладывая в его постепенное развитие.
texts.en:
Andrei and his family live in Novaya Kahovka. He sells computer equipment, and further provides services like computer maintenance and repair. Andrei has been working in this business for 14 years already. Currently he rents a retail space at a shopping center, where his small store and service center is located. His most popular goods are notebooks, monitors, computer cases and printers. 

Andrei has noticed that he needs to fill up with components for personal computers. However his available funds are insufficient to purchase all that he has planned for. Therefore Andrei turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 4,000 hryvnia.

Andrei is married and he has two sons. He has to feed his family, and therefore he plans to continue doing business, investing in its gradual development.

loans.use: to purchase additional components for personal computers

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es: El señor Hilarion es Casado desde hace varios años, radica en el trópico de Cochabamba, en la colonia los bravos del Municipio de Entre ríos, desde hace 12 años. EL cliente es de la provincia  chapare,  del sector de  rodeo, vino de su comunidad  como la mayoría de las personas buscando mayor oportunidad de vida, en su comunidad la producción bajo debido a los cambios climatológicos, difícil de controlar, cada vez la producción era  escaso,  por lo que decidió ir al trópico, pero con el transcurso del tiempo,  con mucho trabajo y  esfuerzo se compró su lote agrícola, en la que hoy en día trabaja en el sector agrícola. El crédito que está solicitando es para hacer mantenimiento de su cultivo, necesita dinero para pagar mano de obra no calificada, insumos agrícolas,  así de esta manera podrá seguir creciendo, su deseo más grande es cultivar a mayor escala, solo así de esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Hilarion has been married for years, and for 12 years now he's lived in the tropics of Cochabamba, Los Bravos neighborhood, municipality of Entre Rios.
He originates from the Chapare province, the rodeo sector and he left his community like many other people in search of more opportunities.  In his community production fell due to climate changes that are difficult to control and crop production was increasingly scarce, which is why he decided to head for the tropics.  With time, effort, and hard work he was able to purchase his own plot of land for farming in an agricultural sector.  The loan he is soliciting is to provide upkeep to his land, to purchase agricultural products, and pay for general labor.  This way he can continue to grow and his biggest wish is to farm on a larger scale and this way improve is quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products, cost of land upkeep, and to pay for general labor

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Catalina cuenta con 14 integrantes mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias.El comite Santa Catalina se destaca por la unidad y el deseo de progresar como grupo invirtiendo  para mejorar sus puestos de trabajos y las que aun no tiene quieren iniciar con este pequeño crédito para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes, la señora Maria se dedica a la venta de gallinas. Ella es la encargada de alimentarlas y de brindarles los cuidados necesarios para poder venderlos al mejor precio y en el mejor estado posible. 
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar el alimento y también para construir un local adecuado para las gallinas.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina committee is comprised of fourteen women who make their livings in various trades. The Santa Catalina committee stands out for the unity of the group and its desire to progress by investing in improvements to their businesses. Those that still don't have businesses want to begin, through this little loan, to improve the quality of life for themselves and their families.

One of the members, Maria, makes her living selling hens. She is in charge of feeding them and providing them with the necessary care in order to be able to sell them at the best price and in the best possible condition.

The requested loan will be used to buy feed and also to construct an adequate space for the hens.

loans.use: to buy hens and feed for later sale

loans.name: Abhimanu

texts.en:
Abhimanu is a 35-year-old differently-able person. He lives with his wife; one son, age 10; and a daughter, age 4. He earns 3,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month from his variety shop. He sells betel, biscuits and wafers, and incense sticks in his betel shop. He needs to go to the market to get the goods when required. He does not have enough funds to stock these goods in bulk amounts. As a physically-challenged person, it is difficult to go to the market very frequently, and he is not able to meet his customers' demands. He wants to purchase goods like chocolates and wafers in bulk and to stock personal care products like soaps, shampoo, etc.

Abhimanu requested a loan of 20,000 INR to purchase a refrigerator, goods (biscuits and wafers, incense sticks) and add some personal care items like soap, shampoo, etc. He dreams of growing his business so that he can meet his customers' demands and he can send his children to a good school and provide them with study materials.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, goods like biscuits, wafers and incense sticks, and to add some personal care items like soap, shampoo, etc., for his variety shop.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
Marisela tiene 27 años, vive en compañía de su hijo Franklin, en una casa que alquila desde hace 4 años. 
Desde niña aprendió el oficio de la agricultura, desde ese entonces adquirió todo el conocimiento necesario para emprenderlo por ella misma. Le va bien en la siembra, pero como ella es una mujer inteligente, notó una necesidad en el pueblo: no existía tienda de comestibles, por lo que decidió abrir una, ya tiene 3 años de experiencia y en todo este tiempo logró adquirir más alimentos y surtir su negocio. “Es difícil empezar, aún comienzo no tenía lo necesario, poco a poco pude obtener más”, mencionó muy contenta. Marisela todos los día se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, a los que día a recibe en su casa, donde acondicionó su negocio. Ahora desea seguir progresando mejorando cada día más. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Los ángeles de Ccano” y este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero. Gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio, asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Marisela invertirá este dinero en la compra de sacos de arroz, azúcar y bebidas, para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Marisela, 27, lives with her son Franklin in a house she has been renting for 4 years. As a child, she learned to farm, and from then on, she acquired the knowledge she needed to start out on her own. Planting has gone well. However, being an intelligent woman, she noted that the village lacked a grocery store, and she decided to open one. She has been running the store for 3 years and has managed to purchase a wider variety of inventory for it. “It is difficult to get started, and though I didn't have everything I needed, I managed to slowly get more," she said happily.

Marisela gets up early every day to cater to her customers, who come to the store in her house. She hopes to keep improving it over time. She is a member of the communal bank “Los ángeles de Ccano.” This is her second loan cycle with MFP, and she hopes to continue receiving financial support from the institution. She likes working with her group, where each day she leans new things about her business. She promises to make her payments on time. Marisela will use this loan to to buy sacks of rice and sugar and soft drinks for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sugar and soft drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Jeiko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El comité Jeiko Porave Rekavo se encuentra en el 2º Ciclo del programa, cuenta  con 10 integrantes mujeres, todas vecinas de la misma comunidad que se dedican a activiades varias.El comité se encuentra muy agradecido con la Fundación y espera cumplir con sus metas ya que se encuentran muy entusiasmadas con los nuevos retos.
Una de las integrates, la señora Jacinta se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como maquillajes y cremas para mujeres.
El crédito solicitado sería para la compra de productos como sombras, bases, rimmel, etc todo lo necesario para los maquillajes tanto diurnos como nocturnos.
texts.en:
The program for the communal bank, Jeiko Porave Rekavo, is in its 2nd term and has 10 female members.  They are all neighbors in their community and all work in different areas.  They are very thankful to the organization and hope to meet all their goals.  They are all very excited about their new challenges.  
One of the members, Jacinta, sells cosmetics like makeup and creams for women.  The loan solicited would be used to purchase products like shade, foundation, eye liner, etc.. Everything necessary for day and night makeup.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics such as: makeup, and creams for women.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 54 años, está casado Camila, con quien tiene siete hijos, a los que educó con mucho amor y ya son independientes. Ahora ellos viven solos en la casa que compraron hace 40 años. 
Desde niño, su vida se desarrolló en el campo, gusta mucho de vivir ahí y producir la tierra. Sus principales productos son papa, habas, olluco y trigo, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues sabe que en épocas de cosecha obtendrá la recompensa por su trabajo y constancia. Gracias a su esfuerzo, ahora posee grandes extensiones de terrenos agrícolas; “siembro todo lo que produce la tierra, para producir un producto en temporada se tiene que invertir mínimo 10 mil nuevos soles”, comenta. Es por esa razón que Domingo trabaja mucho para poder adquirir el capital necesario para la próxima siembra. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos para que tengan más valor en el mercado. Está seguro de conseguirlo, ya que también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, de los que diariamente extrae 30 litros de leche, lo que vendé y le genera ingresos diarios que cubre los gastos del hogar. 

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Central Checche” y este es su crédito número 11 con MFP, por lo espera continuar con este apoyo financiero. Le gusta trabajar en su grupo, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio, asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Domingo invertirá este dinero en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y el pago de los peones que le están ayudando en la siembra de sus productos.
texts.en:
Domingo is 54 years old and is married to Camila. They have seven children, now independent, who they raised with much love.  They now live alone in the house that they bought forty years ago.

Since childhood, he has lived his life in the country and he really enjoys living there and cultivating the land. His main products are potatoes, broad beans, and ullocos (a twining perennial herb native to the Andes bearing fleshy tubers), and wheat, which he cultivates with much care because he knows that, at harvest time, he will be rewarded for his hard work and perseverance. Thanks to his hard work, he now owns large tracts of farmland.  “I plant everything that the land produces, and to produce a product in season, you have to invest a minimum of 10 thousand nuevos soles”, he says.  For this reason, Domingo is working hard to be able to acquire the necessary capital for the next planting.  Now, he wishes to improve the quality of his products so that they will have more value at the market. He is sure of achieving his goal because he also raises cattle.  He extracts 30 liters of milk from them daily and sells it.  In this way, he generates income to cover the household expenses.  

He belongs to the solidarity group “Central Checcche”.  This is his eleventh loan with MFP and he hopes to continue receiving financial support from them.  He enjoys working in his group, where each day he learns new things about his business. In addition, he promises to be punctual with his payments.Domingo will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizers and in the payment of farmhands that are helping him plant his products.

loans.use: to purchase of organic fertilizers and in the payment of farmhands that are helping him plant his products.

loans.name: Montaha

texts.en:
Montaha is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Hussam appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Montaha is a 21-year-old young woman. She is married to Hussam and is mother to one daughter. Her husband is a school teacher; he also operates a small grocery store.

Montaha wants to help her husband with his work, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing a new laptop. This will help Montaha's husband do his school reports and help him operate his grocery store calculations. This will ensure a better future for Montaha's husband and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: La cliente Mariela, es una señora de 31 años de edad, estada casada con señor Ramiro, la cliente trabaja en su mismo domicilio, la cliente tiene una tienda de barrio, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 6 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente no es propia, la cliente vive con su esposo en alquiler, ambos tienen 2 hijos dependientes y el destino es para la compra de mercadería para la tienda que tiene, ya que la cliente con la mercadería que tiene no es suficiente para la venta, tiene muy pocos productos para la venta y con la compra de más mercadería tendrá más ingresos y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su familia, ya que en este momento su esposo no se encuentra trabajando, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: Mariela is a 31 year old lady who is married to Ramiro and works from home.  She owns a neighborhood store and is currently living in the southern part of Cochabamba, approximately 6km away from the city. She and her husband are renting and have 2 children that depend on them.  The goal is to purchase merchandise for the store because she does not have enough stock for sale.  She has few products to sell and by purchasing more merchandise she will have more sales and one way or the other she'll be able to fulfill the needs of the family.  Her husband is currently unemployed and we share a part of her story with all of you for your consideration.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to improve her store

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean is 41  years old and married, blessed with seven children. They live happily in a small village of Oddar Meanchey province. 

Hean has spent most of her lifetime in rice husbandry to make a livelihood. She pursued her business to provide a good education to all her children. All of them are very grateful to their parents and always help them in managing the maintenance of the rice field, whenever their class schedule permits. 

As her rice is growing, Hean needs supplies to spread on it to enable its growth quickly and to protect it from insects. Because of inadequate capital, Hean is requesting a credit through HKL to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her rice crop. 

She hopes to have better yields in the coming season with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her rice crop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking mother of two grade-school children.  She is 30 years old and married and lives with her family in the village of Roxas, Isabela. 

She manages retailing of different goods like bags, school supplies, accessories, and many more, in Mallig and Quezon, Isabela. 

Her retailing business is now seven years in operation. Her earned income in the business is PHP 10,000 each month during peak season of harvest, but if not, her income is definitely lower. 

She first joined this ASKI loan program in 2008, and this is her second loan request. She hopes to have a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used in buying the usual goods that she is selling. 

In the future, Jocelyn wanted to improve the business to have bigger income and to be able to stand alone without borrowing anymore. Her utmost dream is to have the business sustainable for her family.

loans.use: to buy various accessories, cosmetics, school supplies, bags, and assorted goods like needles and threads.

loans.name: Satia

texts.en:
Satia is a 32-year-old widow. She lives in Odisha with her daughter, age 10. Her husband was a farmer. He was supporting his family with whatever he could make from agriculture. Unfortunately, he passed away in 2002 in an accident. Since then, Satia has taken on the entire burden of her family. 

Satia is making garlands using different artificial flowers, threads, etc. She sells at the nearest market. Satia earns 1,500 Indian rupees (INR) from this business. It is a seasonal business. She works for six months in this activity and for the other six months she works as a daily labourer. She has a cow and one year experience in dairy activity. 

Satia requested a loan of 30,000 INR to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. She believes that she can earn 4,000 to 4,500 INR per month from this business. She has a dream of providing a better education for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a cow and repairing her cow shed.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma pertenece al banco comunal VALLECITO ,la socia tiene 33 años,03 hijos y es conviviente,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias coin el negocio de compra y venta de artesania ,la socia vende polos,chuyos,chompas,casacas,guantes entre otros,la socia compra su mercaderia para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan como tiendas del sector turismo,la socia lleva años en este pequeño negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empñeo que le pone a su negocio cada dia,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de chompas de alpaca para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the communal bank VALLECITO. She is 33 years old, has three children, and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling handicrafts. Vilma sells shirts, chuyos (traditional Peruvian hats), sweaters, jackets, and gloves, among other things. She buys her merchandise and then distributes it to the customers that order from her the most, such as the stores in the tourism sector. She has been in this small business for several years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every single day. She is a responsible and enterprising person, since this is the way that she moves her family forward.

She is applying for the loan to buy sweaters made of alpaca wool for her business. She is thankful the credit given and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sweaters made of alpaca wool for her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 34 años, vive en compañía de su hija Nery. Viven en la casa de su madre, con su hija y sus hermanas. 
Su principal ingreso económico es por la agricultura, desde niña aprendió este oficio, pues sus padres eran agricultores. En la actualidad no cuenta con terrenos propios, pero eso no la desanima, ya que desea seguir trabajando con mucho ahínco para poder comprar un auto con el que pueda realizar trasporte público con su esposo.  Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, habas y alverja, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero para cubrir el alquiler de los terrenos. También trabaja en sociedad con otros agricultores, con quienes comparte los gastos de la siembra y las ganancias. Ahora está ahorrando dinero para comprar sus terrenos agrícolas propios.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Central Checche” y este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera continuar con este apoyo financiero, pues gusta de trabajar en su asociación, donde cada día aprende nuevas cosas sobre su negocio. Asimismo, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. 
Margarita invertirá el dinero de este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para la siembra de papa, ya que se encuentra en temporada de siembra grande.
texts.en:
Margarita is 34 years old and she and her daughter, Nery, live in her Mother's home with her sisters. 

Margarita's principal income is derived from agriculture. Since childhood, Margarita has been learning this occupation, as her parents were farmers. At present, she lacks her own land but this hasn't discouraged her. Margarita keeps on working with much determination to be able to buy a car to transport her and her husband.

Their main crops are potatoes, beans, and peas, which they cultivate with great care, in order to cover the cost of renting the land. Also, they work with other farmers, with whom they share the costs of planting and the earnings. Now, they are saving money to buy their own agricultural fields.

Margarita belongs to the “Central Checche” solidarity group and this is her 3rd loan through MFP.
