texts.es: Carmen de 57 años de edad es comerciante de medicamentos naturales, cosméticos, ropa, perfumería y similares, negocio que iniciara  desde el año 1999, cuando una de sus amigas la enseñó, pues antes de se emprendedora  trabajó como empleada de una empresa, sus principales productos son la ropa productos refrescantes, hidratantes, que controlan el peso y de belleza. A sus clientes ofrece estos artículos directamente sin intermediarios y en las modalidades de contado y a crédito. Ella ha estructurado una clientela fija, entre amas de casa, empleados independientes y trabajadores de empresas, que también le compran. En la actualidad su clientela se ha ampliado y el capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para responderle a sus pedidos no es suficiente, pues debe esperar recuperar el dinero producto de sus cuentas por cobrar; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos hidratante, reductores de pesos y cosméticos, con los cuales dará respuesta a su mercado, aumentando así el volumen de sus ventas y la estructura de su negocio, porque finalmente ese es el objetivo que persigue.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 57, sells natural medicines, cosmetics, clothes, perfume, and similar items.  She started the business in 1999 when one of her friends taught her how.  Before being an entrepreneur, she worked as an employee in a company. 

Her main products are clothes, skin care products, moisturizers, products for weight control, and beauty products.  She offers these products directly to her customers without intermediaries.  She sells for cash and on credit.  She has established a fixed clientele of housewives, independent workers, and people who work in businesses who also buy from her.  

Her clientele has now grown, and she does not have enough working capital to respond to their orders.  Therefore she needs to wait to recuperate her money from her accounts receivable.

That is why she turns to a Kiva loan.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy moisturizing products, weight reduction products, and cosmetics.  These products will respond to her market.  They will increase her sales volume and the structure of her business, which is the eventual objective she is pursuing.

loans.use: to buy moisturizing products, weight reduction products, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gokula

texts.en:
Gokula is a 25-year-old physically challenged person living with his parents, wife, sister and two children, a son, age 2 years and daughter, age 3 years. 

He owns and manages a grocery shop where he sells lentils, wheat flour, rice, toffees, chocolates, detergents, salt, edible oil, spices, salts, etc. He earns 2,000 INR per month. His father helps him in bringing stock from the market, which is three kilometers away from his place.

He wants to renovate his shop and increase his inventory by purchasing more stock of what he sells. He has applied for a loan of 25,000 INR for purchasing grains, wheat flour, edible oil, and other household items that he sells in his shop.

He has a dream to give his parents a good life, get her sister married in a good family and save some money for his children’s future.

loans.use: to buy grains, wheat flour, edible oil, and other household items for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa esta ubicada en la zona La Portada de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleada por más de ocho horas al día en una empresa privada y en su tiempo libre confecciona chamarras de ambos sexos; ya que con lo que gana debe ayudar con los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de tela, forro e hilo por cantidad ya que desea elaborar chamarras por cantidad y venderlas para mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Liz es mejorar sus ingresos y poder independizarse ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Liz is single and has no children. She lives at the home of her parents which only has one room. The house is located in the District of La Portada in the city of La Paz.

Liz is currently employed at a private company where she works more than eight hours a day. In her spare time, she produces jackets for both sexes. With the money she earns, she is able to help pay for food and basic services for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, lining, and thread in quantity so that she can produce jackets in bulk that she can sell. This will help to improve her earnings. Liz dreams of earning more income and becoming independent. She wants to be more comfortable and have a better quality of life.

This is the fourth time she has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials for producing jackets.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en: As the married mother of 10 children, Cornelia works hard to support her family. She earns a living by making items out of shells and has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy the raw materials she needs to make more items to sell. She has sustained her business activities thanks in part to six previous loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shell-crafting business.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique y su esposo son originarios de Nuevo Laredo están casados y tiene dos hija que están actualmente cursando el ciclo escolar de la primaria.
Esta solicitando un crédito para cubrir los gastos de la escuela que son el pago de las inscripciones, compra de los útiles y uniformes.
El señor Enrique es empleado de una restaurant de un hotel, su esposo se ha dedicado el cuidado y atención de la familia. 
Desea brindarles a sus hijas una buena educación y calidad de vida para que en el futuro sean unas triunfadoras.
texts.en: Enrique and his spouse are natives of Nuevo Laredo. They are married and have two daughters who are currently enrolled in grade school. He is applying for a loan in order to cover the cost of school expenses, which include enrollment, supplies, and uniforms. Enrique is employed at a hotel restaurant, and his spouse works at home as a caretaker. He wishes to provide his daughters with a good education and quality of life so that in the future they will be high achievers.

loans.use: to pay school expenses.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Calilic, Sibutad. Beatriz owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. 

Beatriz is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase farm chemicals. Beatriz been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, she plans to save her profits in order to buy another plot of farm land.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 20 years old, single and lives with his six family members. His dad contributes to the family income, while Walaa owns and operates a barber shop. He established his business in 2010 and now has lots of experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community. He is requesting an $1,800 youth loan to buy an air-conditioner and a small generator. His goal is to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and a small generator.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en: Venuste is 45 years old. He sells goats, which he has been doing for 10 years.  He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more goats to sell. Venuste will save the profits from the business until he accumulates enough to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase goats to sell.

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru:
Мухамади житель района Дж. Руми. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Мухамади занимается растениеводством. Он более тридцати лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Кроме того Мухамади занимается животноводством. Этот вид деятельности является основным источником дохода его семьи.
Мухамади просит кредит для закупа бычка и телят с целью увеличения поголовья скота. Кроме того он хочет за счет полученной прибыли приобрести небольшой участок земли.
texts.en:
Muhamadi is a 48-year-old man living in the region of J. Rumy. He is married and has five children. 

Muhamadi works in crop farming, and he has been raising crops for more than 30 years. He has also been working in animal husbandry for more than 8 years, and this work is his family's main source of income. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase a bull and some calves so that he can increase the overall amount of cattle he owns. Additionally, he wants to purchase a plot of land with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and some calves

loans.name: Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: Esta es la nueva Alcancía Comunal “Para un Futuro Mejor” conformado por 07 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar con el Programa- Prosperidad. En esta oportunidad conocerán a nuestro socio Raphael de 26 años padre de 02 hijos con una pareja que le brinda todo su apoyo. El comenzó trabajando en una empresa vendiendo gas, con los conocimientos que adquirió y los deseos de superación decide emprender su propio negocio donde actualmente se dedica a la venta de gas en su vivienda, además ofrece bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Con su trabajo y esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su familia, ya que es el único sustento de su hogar. Solicito el crédito para la compra de balones de gas y cervezas. Su mayor deseo es de seguir creciendo en su negocio de la venta de gas. Raphael es el segundo del lado izquierdo viste polo amarillo y pantalón plomo. El está agradecido ya que ayudan a su progreso.
texts.en:
This is a new Communal Bank known as “Para un Futuro Mejor” (For a Better Future). The group consists of seven enthusiastic members who have started working with the “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) program.

EDAPROSPO has taken this opportunity to get to know Raphael, one of the members of this group. He is 26 years old and the father of two children he cares for with the support of his partner. Raphael began working at a company that sells fuel. With the knowledge he gained and his desire to succeed, Raphael decided to start his own business in which he currently sells fuel from his home. He also sells beverages, such as sodas and beer. Through his work and effort, Raphael has been able to continue supporting his family since this is now his only source of income.

He is requesting a loan to buy tanks of fuel and beer. His greatest wish is to continue growing his fuel business. Raphael is the second person on the right wearing a yellow shirt and gray trousers. He is grateful for the assistance that will allow him to make progress.

loans.use: to buy tanks of fuel and beer.

loans.name: Mardonkul

texts.ru: Мардонкул житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Мардонкул занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Животноводством Мардонкул занимается с восемнадцати лет. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Мардонкул берет кредит для закупа крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Mardonkul lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 52 years old, married, and has four children. Mardonkul is an animal farmer and breeds cattle at home. He has been working with livestock since he was eighteen and has a wealth of experience in this area. Mardonkul is taking this loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: Для закупа телят

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Daisy requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as pants, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Daisy would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as pants, slippers and other ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mahubedjro Group

texts.fr: MAHUBEDJRO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Philomène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Cyriaque. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé, et un reste à leur charge. Philomène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté. Il y a près de huit ans que Philomène mène comme activité la vente des savons de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité, Philomène vend des tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Philomène sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUBEDJRO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAHUBEDJRO is a group consisting of three people, whose members are friends. The representative of the group, Philomène (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 35 years old and is married to a mechanic named Cyriaque. The couple has two children, of whom one goes to school, and one stays under their care. Philomène and her husband live together with their children. Philomène did not go to school.

For almost eight years Philomène has been in business selling soap as a street trader. Simultaneously, Philomène sells fabric and cooking utensils. Philomène gets her supplies in a market in Bénin and in Togo. In seeking to satisfy her clientèle, Philomène is requesting a second loan with the other members of the MAHUBEDJRO group. This loan will help them to better respond to their clientèle's demands and to make more profits. The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Elena requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Elena has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Elena  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: o buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Eden requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Eden would like to save enough money to renovate her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen, 33, is married with two children, one in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Karen has a general store (sari sari) business in the Philippines. Karen requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Karen would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her convenience store.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 56 years old and widowed with five children.

Carmen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her store.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from dressmaking, raising livestock and food vending.

Carmen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 54-year-old, married man and the father of five children.

He has been the owner of a food market since 2008.  He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products.  He has 20 years of experience in this field.  His market is situated in a crowded area with a good number of customers passing by, including nearby school students and teachers.

Moussa decided to apply for a loan to buy new, good-value products for his market such as conserves, toys and vegetables.
This loan is being requested by Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, and is his sixth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower of very good standing.

Moussa aims to increase his profits and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To buy new good-value products for his store.
